bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A commission called the British Columbia Vegetable Marketing Commission is established to administer the scheme under the supervision of the British Columbia Farm Industry Review Board.
The commission consists of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a chair appointed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council;
up to 8 members who are commercial producers, elected by the commercial producers.
the member serving as chair when this regulation comes into force continues to hold that office until the Lieutenant Governor in Council makes an appointment under subsection (3.2) (a), and

the members serving on the board when this regulation comes into force continue to hold their offices until elections are held under approved practices and procedures for elections established under subsection (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The commission must establish and publish practices and procedures for the election of elected board members.
The British Columbia Farm Industry Review Board must approve the rules and procedures referred to in subsection (5) before those rules take effect.

change.changenote: Section 3 (3) to (5) BEFORE self repealed by BC Reg 96/80, effective June 30, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (2) and any term of an elected member established under a practice, procedure or rule referred to in section 3 (5) or (6), as those subsections read on July 30, 2021,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an elected member who was serving on the commission as of July 30, 2021 may continue to serve on the commission until

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: May 31, 2022, if the member's term expires on or before May 31, 2022, or
until the member's term expires, if the member's term expires after May 31, 2022, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the term of a commercial producer who is elected, between July 31, 2021 and May 31, 2022, to serve on the commission does not begin until May 31, 2022.
